statement.p: A physician ordered Norvir (ritonavir) 600 mg. Norvir (ritonavir) has a concentration of 80 mg per 1 milliliters.
What volume should be administered? mL

solution.p: The unit suggest we can multiply. \displaystyle{600}\ \text{ mg}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ \text{ mL}}}{{{80}\ \text{ mg}}}={7.5} mL
By dividing we determine how many 80 mg units we need to deliver the total 600 mg.
